articles.title: Open-Source Software
articles.description: Software that I have developed over the years.
articles.contents:
Contents
Creator
Contributor

Creator


BGGM: Bayesian Gaussian Graphical Models
The {BGGM} R package is a collection of tools for making Bayesian inference in Gaussian graphical models. The are organized around two general approaches for Bayesian inference: (1) estimation and (2) hypothesis testing. The computationally intensive tasks (e.g., custom MCMC samplers) are written in c++ via the R package Rcpp (Eddelbuettel et al. 2011) and the c++ library Armadillo (Sanderson and Curtin 2016). The Bayes factors are computed with the R package BFpack (Mulder et al. 2019). There is full support for continuous, binary, ordinal, and mixed data (via a Gaussian copula graphical model).


 Website


Contributor
References





















Eddelbuettel, Dirk, Romain François, J Allaire, Kevin Ushey, Qiang Kou, N Russel, John Chambers, and D Bates. 2011. “Rcpp: Seamless r and c++ Integration.” Journal of Statistical Software 40 (8): 1–18.


Mulder, Joris, Xin Gu, Anton Olsson-Collentine, Andrew Tomarken, Florian Böing-Messing, Herbert Hoijtink, Marlyne Meijerink, et al. 2019. “BFpack: Flexible Bayes Factor Testing of Scientific Theories in r.” arXiv Preprint arXiv:1911.07728.


Sanderson, Conrad, and Ryan Curtin. 2016. “Armadillo: A Template-Based c++ Library for Linear Algebra.” Journal of Open Source Software 1 (2): 26. https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.00026.
